item.title: Nicola Sturgeon plea to Raab over Scot held in India
item.description: The first minister calls on the foreign secretary to meet the family of a man held in prison in India for four years.

item.title: Gunshots fired at Edinburgh home in 'targeted attack'
item.description: A man, woman and two young children were in the house in Edinburgh when the incident happened.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Where are the latest cases?
item.description: A daily update on the number and location of coronavirus cases in Scotland.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Education Secretary Shirley-Anne Somerville tests positive
item.description: Dunfermline MSP Shirley-Anne Somerville says she has lost her sense of smell and is self-isolating.

item.title: Man dies in hospital after Stonehaven boat capsize rescue
item.description: The 61-year-old was with two other men in a small fishing boat when it overturned in Catterline Bay, Stonehaven.

item.title: In Pictures: Cyclists return for long-distance Loch Ness race
item.description: The 66-mile race was the first cycle sportive event to take place in Scotland since the easing of Covid restrictions.

item.title: Covid: Antibody tests offered to public for first time
item.description: The UK-wide scheme for adults who test positive for coronavirus will launch next week.

item.title: Dame Ellen MacArthur to advise ministers on environment
item.description: The round-the-world yachtswoman is among the experts appointed to a new Scottish government committee.

item.title: SNP ruling body endorses deal with Greens
item.description: Nicola Sturgeon said the agreement had been "unanimously endorsed" following a very upbeat meeting.

item.title: Eileen Barrott death: Husband charged with murder
item.description: Eileen Barrott died at the couple's home a week ago after being found seriously injured.

item.title: Scots rally expresses solidarity with the people of Afghanistan
item.description: People have gathered in Glasgow's George Square to highlight fears over the Taliban's return to power.

item.title: Boris Johnson's Irish Sea tunnel vision - roadworthy or pipe dream?
item.description: A BBC documentary asks how serious is Boris Johnson about a link from Scotland to Northern Ireland?

item.title: Covid in Scotland: How have the rules changed?
item.description: Scotland's levels system of restrictions have come to an end - but what does that mean people can do?

item.title: Covid: Is Scotland lagging behind on vaccine certificates?
item.description: A digital "passport" has been rolled out across the EU - so why does Scotland use a paper system?

item.title: Is the coronavirus pandemic over at last?
item.description: As Scotland loosens most of its remaining restrictions, is the devastating pandemic finally at an end?

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Your questions answered on life after level zero
item.description: Readers have been sending in their questions about what the ending of more Covid rules means for them.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Are young people slowing the vaccine drive?
item.description: Concerns have been raised about vaccine uptake among younger adults, but are they less likely to want a jab? Here, we examine the statistics.

item.title: Covid map: Coronavirus cases, deaths, vaccinations by country
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: 'Why I am giving up my home to climate activists'
item.description: The cost of staying in Glasgow during the world climate change summit means activists are helping each other out.

item.title: Why do I need more smoke alarms in my house?
item.description: Legislation is being introduced that requires all homes to have interlinked smoke alarms fitted.

item.title: Afghan refugee fled to Glasgow with family to escape Taliban torture
item.description: A man who worked as an interpreter for the British Army tells of his relief at being resettled in Glasgow.

item.title: Film buff rescues more than 20,000 VHS tapes set for dump
item.description: A video shop owner travelled from Liverpool to Dundee to pick up the massive haul from a collector.

item.title: 'Linda would be heartbroken for Afghanistan's women'
item.description: Scots aid worker Linda Norgrove was killed in Afghanistan 10 years ago and a women's rights charity was set up in her name.

item.title: SNP and Greens seal power-sharing deal
item.description: The SNP and the Scottish Greens set out their power-sharing deal for Holyrood.

item.title: Film buff rescues more than 20,000 VHS tapes set for dump
item.description: A video shop owner travelled from Liverpool to Dundee to pick up the massive haul from a collector.

item.title: Firefighters tackle early morning blaze in Glasgow city centre
item.description: The Scottish Fire and Rescue Service said that around 45 firefighters were sent to the scene on Wednesday morning.

item.title: Mum of Scots soldier on trauma of Taliban resurgence
item.description: The mother of a Scottish soldier killed in Afghanistan has said she feels "disgusted" watching the deteriorating situation in the country.

item.title: Afghanistan: ‘My family are trapped in the middle of a war’
item.description: Former refugee Abdul Bostani, who fled the Taliban, speaks of his fears for his family in Afghanistan.

item.title: Ross County 2-4 Rangers: Visitors secure thrilling win
item.description: Scott Arfield came off the bench to end Ross County's comeback as Rangers averted a second successive Scottish Premiership slip-up.

item.title: Hearts 1-1 Aberdeen: Both sides extend unbeaten starts after frantic draw
item.description: Hearts and Aberdeen continue their unbeaten Scottish Premiership starts and join Hibernian at the top after a frantic draw at Tynecastle.

item.title: St Johnstone 0-1 Dundee United: Peter Pawlett scores and gets sent off in victory
item.description: Peter Pawlett scored the winner and was also sent off as Dundee United earned a closely-fought win against St Johnstone to record consecutive Scottish Premiership victories.

item.title: Dundee 2-2 Hibernian: Late McGowan header earns hosts point in entertaining draw
item.description: Hibernian move to the top of the Scottish Premiership despite Paul McGowan's late header earning Dundee a point in a pulsating draw.
